meanings.definition: Knarred (adjective): having knarls or gnarls; knotty
meanings.sent1: The old tree had knarred branches that twisted in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The knarred wood was difficult to carve due to its twisted grain.
meanings.sent3: The knarred tree stump looked like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her knarred fingers moved slowly over the rough surface of the bark.
meanings.sent5: The knarred roots of the tree seemed to reach out like gnarled fingers.

meanings.definition: Knarred (verb): past tense of knar, to make knarred or gnarled
meanings.sent1: He knarred the wood by carving intricate patterns into it.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman knarred the surface of the sculpture to give it a textured look.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally knarred the clay vase while trying to shape it.
meanings.sent4: The artist knarred the metal to create a unique design on the jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully knarred the stone to bring out its natural beauty.
